name: Funds spent for business R&D performed in the United States, by type of R&D, source of funds, and size of company: 2017–19
description: Funds spent for business R&D performed in the United States, by type of R&D, source of funds, and size of company: 2017–19

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: selected_characteristic_and_company_size
variableMeasured.description: Selected characteristic and company size hierarchy

specialValues.D: suppressed to avoid disclosure of confidential information

notes: Detail may not add to total because of rounding. Beginning in survey year 2018, companies that performed or funded less than $50,000 of R&D were excluded from tabulation. These companies in aggregate represented a very small share of total R&D expenditures in prior years. Had the companies under this threshold been included in the 2018 estimates, they would have contributed approximately $90 million to overall R&D expenditures. Excludes data for federally funded research and development centers.
sources: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics and Census Bureau, Business Enterprise Research and Development Survey.
